questions.question: Is the woman’s face clearly visible with the same eye shape, nose, mouth, and short wavy black hair as in the original image?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the face of the woman is not visible due to the intentional blurring over her facial area. In Image A, although her face details are blurred, her short wavy black hair is visible. This indicates that the facial features are not clearly visible in Image B due to the blur.

questions.question: Does the robe maintain the red-on-right and navy-blue-on-left color division across the torso and sleeves?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the robe features a red section on the right and a navy-blue section on the left, both extending across the torso and sleeves. This matches the color division shown in Image A, with the same color placement on the respective sides.

questions.question: Are the rose and vine floral patterns visible along the robe’s seams, front panel, and sleeves as in the original image?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the robe displays rose and vine floral patterns along its seams, front panel, and sleeves. This pattern arrangement is similar to that in Image A, maintaining the same decorative design elements in both images.

questions.question: Is there a high slit on the right leg of the robe, revealing part of the leg?
questions.explanation: Image B shows the robe featuring a high slit on the right side, revealing part of an inner skirt or pants. Similarly, Image A also presents a high slit on the right leg of the robe in a similar manner.

questions.question: Are red paper lanterns visible hanging in rows above the market alley, glowing warmly?
questions.explanation: In Image B, there are two red paper lanterns depicted hanging with a warm glow as a part of the calendar theme, but it does not show an alley scene. However, in Image A, red paper lanterns are visible hanging in rows above the market alley and glowing warmly, which isn’t replicated in the same context in Image B.

questions.question: Are there visible stalls with tomatoes, oranges, and green vegetables arranged in crates along both sides of the alley?
questions.explanation: In Image B, there are no visible market stalls or alley scenes depicted. Instead, the image represents a calendar theme without any indication of fresh produce in an alley. In contrast, Image A clearly shows stalls with a variety of vegetables and fruits along an alley.

questions.question: Is the ground paved with stone tiles and the roof supported by wooden beams?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the setting doesn’t depict a physical market scene with a floor or roof structure. In Image A, the market alley is shown with a stone-tiled floor and wooden beam-supported roof, elements not present in the format of Image B.
